episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including the self-impaling habits of North American porcupines, the development of smart clothing that can detect body odor, the impracticality of early rugby games with hundreds of players, and the potential for asteroids to reform after being blown apart.

facts.fact: North American porcupines sometimes fall out of trees and impale themselves on their own spines.
Scientists are developing a t-shirt which tells you when you smell.
Until the 1840s, there was no maximum size for a rugby team, so matches were sometimes played with up to 300 players on the pitch at the same time.
Scientists have discovered that if an asteroid were blown apart, its gravity would pull it back together again.
